lexUnit.name: intrigue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arouse the curiosity or interest of.

sentence.text: Many foreign visitors , intrigued by her story , used to visit Maria Clementina .
By the time dawn came Dinah Asshe was intrigued with the possibilities of her own physical self .
His loftiness irritated and intrigued her .
The notion of publishing one 's own magazine intrigued her .
If Alain had been intrigued by her colouring since he had first seen her then why had n't Marguerite said so ?
If only she could fit the jigsaw together and get a clear picture of this man who so intrigued her .

But she instructed her fast-beating heart not to be so idiotic , that Ven meant nothing by that other than that he was intrigued that her journalistic methods were unlike those of any other journalist he had met .
But human puzzles intrigued him more .
And I do n't think it was your perfection of form that intrigued him … ’
One paragraph particularly intrigued him .
That time element intrigues me .
So my visits to the Ainsworth home were frequent but undemanding , and I had ample opportunity to look out for the little cat which had intrigued me .
` You intrigue me greatly , " he said , puzzled .
Her words intrigued the duke .
The thornier aspects continue to intrigue international legal experts .
This is something that has intrigued thousands of viewers .
Henry was intrigued by Fred 's doings ; he wanted to know more .
Visitors to the castle are often intrigued by the engravings and paintings to be seen above fireplaces and doorways .
Bliss , Lømo , Andersen and many others in the neuroscience community were immediately intrigued by the phenomenon .
` Of course , I kept quiet about what I had seen , but I was intrigued .
A year later , however , he was intrigued to discover that the Ojibwa Indians , who were of different linguistic stock , had the same system .
She was intrigued to know what sort of a woman could handle Alain Lemarchand and she had intended to linger and find out .
But the explicitly linguistic experiments with primates continue to intrigue the non-specialist above all .
He intrigued us and then , when we had the good fortune to meet him socially , he emerged as both a remarkable and idealistic person .
He was on the road for a week , making sketches in villages along the way , intrigued particularly by the lives of weavers .
` I 'm not married -- my sister Berenice is my only relative , but I 'm intrigued by your interest , though you could have just asked me instead of getting angry . "
Intrigued by their free and easy life style , the Parker 's find their long held values being easily manipulated .
Having had to study the figures herself , Kate finally became intrigued by them and decided that she might as well play the stock market on her own .
Everett and Horsley were both intrigued .
She watched him sifting the batch of cards , momentarily intrigued .
